Expectation1: Perform assigned physical tasks and material handling efficiently.
Situation1: A crane is holding a heavy beam in position, and you must immediately help guide it into place before it can be secured.
Situation2: They travel a long distance to participate in an important religious festival, ensuring they fully engage in all rituals and offerings.
Story: I wiped the sweat from my brow as the foreman shouted for us to hurry. The crane was holding a massive steel beam, swaying slightly in the morning breeze. My job was to help guide it into place, steady and precise, so the welders could secure it. Every second counted—if I hesitated, the whole crew would be delayed, and the risk of an accident would rise. But my phone buzzed in my pocket, a reminder from my family. Today was the festival of Navratri, and I had promised to travel home, hours away, to join the rituals and offer prayers with my parents. They expected me to be there, to show my devotion and respect for our traditions. My heart pounded as I looked from the dangling beam to the road leading out of the site. The weight of both worlds pressed on me—my duty to my team, and my duty to my faith and family. I stood frozen, torn between the urgent call of steel and the sacred call of the temple, unsure which demand I could bear to let down.
